content.description:
Climb out of the water with slimmy hard to find feet and sloping edges... A big reach to a slot gets your hands to the top and most find topping out to be the crux... 

  My favorite line at this quarry...
content.location: Right up the middle of the slightly overhanging wall on the left end...

content.description:
Climb out of the water on sloping edges and work up to a corner and a funky topout...  

  Starting can be tough since you can't see your feet and its pretty slimmy down there...
content.location: left side of the slightly overhanging left wall...

content.description:
This is the main jumping spot so be careful as you aproach so you don't get hit... Climb as directly as you can up to the "Diving board" you will have to break a little right as you go... cool crimpy moves and foot work are the name of this game...  

  If you know The Little Mermaid you might get the name...
content.location: Far right side of the cliff...

content.description:
This is a neat little climb... Getting out of the water is pretty moderate since there is a little ledge above water... Then you are face with a small powerful roof with small holds up to a mantle move top out...  

  Not sure on the grade... Feed back would be great if you go climb it... The name is dedicated to generations of drunken party goers that have incidentally made this pretty spot pretty ugly
content.location: The little roof in the middle of the wall..

content.description:
I really don't remember the exact grade but its steep and short with a cooll move or two... 

  Climb out of the water on crimps and hit a lay back move then climb on up...
content.location: Middle section, left of a small roof...

content.description:
Right of the Training Wall look for a right angling dike feature on a less than vertical wall... climb this feature to the top...  

  I really forget how hard this is but they wont let me put "i dont know" for a grade...
content.location: Middle of the wall... Right angled dike...

content.description: If you jump off the Training Wall and can't make it up those problems this can be a good option... Climb out of the water as for the Training Wall Right but break to the right up an easy ramp and an easy mantle move... Then rest up and hit the training Wall again...
content.location: Right side of the Training Wall...

content.description:
This is the smaller cleaner and less sketchy quarry in this area. Clear water and slightly overhanging rock up to about 15 feet high makes this a cool place to experiment with a little beginner DWS. 

  There is a bit of a party scene here but its typically more mellow than the big quarry up the hill. My favorite lines here are on a 15 degree overhanging wall with sloping edges and a committing (but safe) top out. A great place to just chill out and relax on a nice summer day as well.
